attributes.action: Address the Current COVID-19 Situation Regarding Schools.
attributes.additional_details: What I would like are answers. As a school that transitioned to online learning swiftly, I was incredibly fortunate to continue to learn and share lessons with peers, but how does 3 weeks added to the exam dates and some in-examination help compensate for 7 months lost for some? I do not see how this is compensating for 7 months lost of my 2 year course, which means that over a quarter of my course has suffered due to restrictions, and I think it is very unfair for pupils to be left stranded.
attributes.background: After losing 7 months of in-school learning, I think this has put some pupils in a poor position regarding the upcoming exams, and with the surge in cases it has put many pupils out/online due to the rise in cases. We need better time to prepare or would like you to rethink examinations entirely.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. 
	
You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.
